meanings.definition: The siliceous cell wall of a diatom.
meanings.sent1: Under the microscope, the frustule of the diatom looked like a tiny glass box.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the intricate patterns on the frustule of the diatom.
meanings.sent3: The diatom decided to redecorate its frustule with sparkly silica crystals.
meanings.sent4: The frustule of the diatom was as delicate as a snowflake, yet strong as steel.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight glistened on the frustule, creating a mesmerizing display of colors.

meanings.definition: A small, rigid structure in certain algae.
meanings.sent1: The frustule of the algae provided protection against predators.
meanings.sent2: Tiny organisms lived within the frustule of the algae, forming a symbiotic relationship.
meanings.sent3: The algae used its frustule as a shield during the underwater battle.
meanings.sent4: The frustule of the algae stood firm against the turbulent currents, like a fortress in the sea.
meanings.sent5: Children marveled at the intricate design of the frustule, imagining it as a tiny castle for algae.
